intro: Pycreus lijiangensis, commonly known as the Liangjiang pycreus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Yunnan province in China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae, which includes various ferns and their allies. The plant is characterized by its delicate, intricate fronds that exhibit a unique pattern of venation. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions with high biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pycreus lijiangensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
